availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis Todd (Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Virginia native. Married to Nancy Howes Todd. Father of Sarah E. Todd, Katherine Todd, Martha J. Todd, James C. Todd, Susan Todd, Mary Todd, and Johnson Todd. Farmer in Johnson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. Employed Manford Friend as a saddler in Johnson County in 1860. Employed John W. Walker in Johnson County in 1860. Removed as justice of the peace in Johnson County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 80B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 151.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, Paint, p. 398B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #10611.
KYR-0001-031-0096.
